title: Maintenance Specialist - Part Time (Contract)
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for an Operations Associate to join our fast growing Seattle team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primary responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

The selected candidate will start working Sunday through Tuesday (occasionally Wednesday). No remote work is supported.

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Assist our Operations Managers in the set-up of the units with un-boxing, furniture assembly and frames' installation
  • Complete basic maintenance tasks to ensure positive guest experience
  • Perform check-in/outs to our properties according to business standards
  • Be the main point of contact between our guests and the customer experience team
  • Supervise handyman while working on resolving an emergency in our apartments (locksmith, plumber etc.)

What you may focus on:

  • Manage viewings at Blueground properties for prospective clients or partners
  • Perform messenger related duties such as collecting paperwork, delivering items, receiving mail

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to get their hands dirty as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Great at handy work
  • Can perform heavy lifting when needed
  • Is available to work weekends
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Hard working with great attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A positive, confident, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Market competitive salary (hourly rate)
  • Joining a fast growing start up

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Operational Excellence Manager
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities and we have raised more than $80m in funding to date.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.


We are currently looking for an Operational Excellence Manager to join our team in Athens.The role is for a self-motivated, resourceful and proactive experienced leader able to challenge the status quo and lead operational efforts that will improve the lives of clients, team members and partners.

What you will focus on:

  • Leading cross functional operational initiatives including Operations, Customer Experience, Sales, Real Estate and Finance teams
  • Collaborating with all teams in the organization to map, improve and standardize cross functional processes and workflows
  • Developing Project Charters and Project Plans on selected improvement projects across geographies having global impact
  • Leading teams to follow the steps of root cause problem solving methodologies and improve their daily work
  • Designing documents, workflows, KPIs, and perform data analysis
  • Driving continuous improvement efforts to better serve our guests, as well as internal and external partners

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor's Degree or higher required
  • Minimum 4 years of operations and lean management experience, preferably in the services industry or manufacturing
  • Lean six sigma expertise with experience on continuous improvement tools/techniques
  • Strong follow up, prioritization and attention to detail in a fast-paced environment
  • Very strong analytical capabilities
  • Excellent communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Yellow or Green Belt certification would be an asset

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Content Strategist
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised $78m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Content Strategist to join our Marketing department and sit under our Global Brand function. The position is remote for now, and, when conditions permit, based in our NYC headquarters. In an era when people spend more time than ever at home, this is an exciting time for Blueground. We are in the process of developing our brand story and product to adjust to the evolving needs of renters. In support of this, you’ll be using your exceptional copywriting skills to lead all content marketing at Blueground. You will be supporting multiple teams and contribute to shaping the Blueground brand voice through fresh & engaging blog storytelling that garners engagement through social media. You should also possess the ability to develop and translate strategy into compelling brand copy that delivers on business objectives.

What you will focus on:

  • Develop the Blueground voice by both strategizing and executing on marketing copy that spans all marketing channels, including advertising, email & online (from blogs to social media), based on analytics and insights about our target audiences
  • Create and manage all externally-facing copy -- with equal mastery across both short-form (e.g., website, app, ads, social media posts, product descriptions, emails, etc.) and long-form formats (e.g., website, blogs, etc.)
  • Craft and implement effective content marketing strategies to drive, engage, and grow brand awareness through qualified traffic to Blueground’s website and social channels
  • Develop, oversee and maintain a strategic content calendar that consists of a steady cadence of business conversion/leads driven content combined with lifestyle pieces to drive brand awareness & consideration
  • Drive content planning and copy refinement strategy that appeals to distinct audience targets across Blueground’s 3 blogs (Blueprint, Inside Blueground & Landlord Resources)
  • Understand and create both direct response and awareness messaging depending on broader marketing strategy and specific channel goals
  • Forecast budget and manage content performance reporting for continuous optimization, SEO strategies & test-and-learn strategies against set objectives and KPIs
  • Explore & stay abreast of new content channels (e.g., podcast, collaborations with other brands/ambassadors/influencers, etc.) and current best practices across industry and competitor channels

What we are looking for:

  • Excellent written & communication skills
  • Great organization skills, with the ability to manage both big and small content projects & deadlines across multiple teams
  • 3-5 years professional experience driving content strategy & writing/editing creative copy for a consumer/lifestyle brand(s) at a creative agency and/or in-house brand team or startup
  • Bachelor’s degree, preferably in English, business administration, journalism, psychology or other relevant degree
  • Airtight writing skills, demonstrated by a portfolio that highlights blog writing (long-form content), promotional messaging (short-form copy on websites, emails, social media, etc.), multi-channel advertising (e.g., benefit statements, taglines), and bottom-up brand-building (e.g., brand guidelines, brand bible, messaging hierarchies, positioning statements, creative concepts, etc.).
  • Understanding how to apply best practices in blog traffic, SEO, email marketing & social media strategy
  • Experience taking assignments from the ideation & research phase through to publication, optimization, and measurement onsite
  • Gravitas when it comes to taking cross-functional teams on your journey – whether it’s defending the value of a quirky content hook, or re-directing a group work-stream that’s gone off strategy
  • A cultural connoisseur & storyteller with a vital pulse on current cultural trends in interior design, hospitality, music, fashion, and tech
  • A collaborative spirit that lends itself well to working closely with various stakeholders across teams, including remote ones
  • Start-up and rapid growth brand experience is a plus, with demonstrable brand-building experience

Your Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Private life and health insurance plan
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the center of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Client Experience Coordinator (Native-Like German Speaker)
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities and we have raised more than $80m in funding to date.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking to recruit a Client Experience Coordinator based in Athens to join our centralized client experience department and be responsible for our client experience operations in the soon to be lunched city of Vienna. The role is a great opportunity for a hard-working and talented person to gain a real insight into the hospitality industry. If you're someone who possesses a genuine interest in customer service, technical teams coordination and problem-solving and you like to interact with internal and external customers across the business, then this role is for you!

What you will focus on:

  • Receiving complex inquiries from guests and then deciding the right way to resolve the issues while ensuring an excellent client experience
  • Scheduling, collaborating and managing internal and external business partners to ensure operational excellence in Blueground properties
  • Liaising across functions within the business to identify the origin of customer support issues and improve related processes to enhance customer experience
  • Maintaining long-lasting relations with business stakeholders
  • Planning the daily routes of operations associates based on the number of stops, location and type of their tasks assigned, as well as customers' needs and business priorities

What we are looking for:

  • Minimum 3 years of customer service responsibilities experience and working experience in a position including back office operations, alternatively in managing housing construction projects
  • Prior experience in route planning/scheduling will be considered an asset
  • Fluent in German and English with computer literacy
  • Great communication skills, both written and verbal
  • Able to maintain strong professional relationships with customers and business partners
  • Problem-solving attitude
  • Flexibility to work during weekends

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

Please send us your Resume in English

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: QA Inspector - Contractor, LA
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning. But enough of the numbers.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are currently looking for a contract based Quality Assurance Inspector to join our growing team in Los Angeles and take care of Blueground's Product quality. The QA inspector performs scheduled audits in Blueground apartments to ensure compliance of the city in charge with Blueground standards.

What you will focus on:

  • Conduct initial inspection audits at a sample of newly furnished apartments and exit inspection audits at a sample of checked out apartments in order to ensure the apartment’s and furniture’s perfect condition.
  • Estimate and report the level of damage that may have been occurred after guests stay at our apartment
  • Check and evaluate the cleaning services conducted in our properties by cleaning partners
  • Highlight the actual apartment’s condition right before tenant’s check in, through the last minute QA audit
  • Cooperate with QA Team Leader, providing him/her with his/her feedback (through audit reports) regarding the performance of OMs/OAs/Technicians/GRAs/cleaning teams in initial/exit inspections and cleaning sessions

What we are looking for:

  • Minimum 1 year experience in Quality Control inspections
  • Relevant experience in the hospitality sector or in a facilities management company would be a plus
  • Experience working in a Quality Assurance related position would be a plus
  • Ability to conduct technical assessments for apartments
  • Ability to easily commute within the city
  • B.Sc/M.Sc in Quality or Engineering would be a plus
  • Attention to detail (Problem Solving)
  • Very good communication skills - verbal and written (Communication)
  • Data collection, management and analysis experience (Problem Solving)
  • Planning and organizational skills
  • IT Literacy (MS Office, G-Suite)

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Private life and health insurance plan
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

    At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the center of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion

title: Maintenance Specialist (Contract to hire)
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Maintenance Specialist to join our fast growing San Francisco Bay Area team. This position will be based out of San Jose. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests.The role is primary responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise.These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

This is a contract to hire position. This position will require some weekend work; Tuesday to Saturday, or Sunday to Thursday.

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Assist our Operations Managers in the set-up of the units with un-boxing, furniture assembly and frames' installation
  • Complete basic maintenance tasks to ensure positive guest experience
  • Perform check-in/outs to our properties according to business standards
  • Be the main point of contact between our guests and the customer experience team
  • Supervise handyman while working on resolving an emergency in our apartments (locksmith, plumber etc.)

What you may focus on:

  • Manage viewings at Blueground properties for prospective clients or partners
  • Perform messenger related duties such as collecting paperwork, delivering items, receiving mail

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to get their hands dirty as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • Great at handy work
  • Can perform heavy lifting when needed
  • Is available to work a weekend day
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Hard working with great attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A valid driver's license and a clean driving record with no traffic violations; as well as a reliable vehicle
  • A positive, confident, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Market competitive salary
  • Corporate cell phone plan
  • Joining a fast growing start up

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Operations Associate - Part Time (Contract)
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for an Operations Associate to join our fast growing Seattle team. The ideal candidate should be a stickler for detail, proactive, skilled in general maintenance tasks and thoughtful as to ensure that the property is continuously in pristine condition for our guests. The role is primary responsible for assisting our Operations Team in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, and handling any issues or emergencies that arise. These issues include but are not limited to handling guest lockouts, emergency relocations, as well as keeping Operations Managers informed of potential repairs and actions being taken.

The selected candidate will start working Sunday through Tuesday (occasionally Wednesday).

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Assist our Operations Managers in the set-up of the units with un-boxing, furniture assembly and frames' installation
  • Complete basic maintenance tasks to ensure positive guest experience
  • Perform check-in/outs to our properties according to business standards
  • Be the main point of contact between our guests and the customer experience team
  • Supervise handyman while working on resolving an emergency in our apartments (locksmith, plumber etc.)

What you may focus on:

  • Manage viewings at Blueground properties for prospective clients or partners
  • Perform messenger related duties such as collecting paperwork, delivering items, receiving mail

What we are looking for:

  • Willingness to get their hands dirty as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Great at handy work
  • Can perform heavy lifting when needed
  • Is available to work weekends
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture
  • Hard working with great attention to detail
  • Ability to multitask and remain calm under pressure
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A positive, confident, upbeat and friendly personality

Your benefits:

  • Market competitive salary (hourly rate)
  • Joining a fast growing start up

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Software Engineer, Front End
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised $78m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Front End Engineer to join our Engineering team in Athens and our mission to offer a world class experience to our customers on the web, office based or remote.

We are a tech enabled company, currently making substantial investments in our technology platform, from our booking website and mobile app to our key business internal software, to enable our next stage of high growth.The person in this role will work on our web products with some of the latest tech goodies, solid engineering practices and demanding requirements on UX, analytics and performance.


Our Stack

  • ES2015+
  • Node.js | Express | Koa
  • MongoDB | Postgres | Redis
  • RabbitMQ
  • Vue.js | Angular | Vanilla.js
  • Jest | WebDriver.io | Cypress.io
  • RESTful APIs | gRPC
  • Serverless
  • GraphQL on Prisma up next

Our code sits on Github, is integrated through Jenkins pipelines and runs on AWS EKS & Lambda. We do project management on JIRA, our prototypes and mockups on Figma and monitor our systems and performance on Datadog and New Relic.


What you'll focus on

  • Architect, design and build product features on Blueground’s web products
  • Deliver rich, responsive, mobile first experiences on the browser
  • Participate in SCRUM ceremonies
  • Code in Vue.js
  • Write your unit tests
  • Write your e2e tests
  • Sometimes write your HTML & CSS
  • Automate stuff
  • Depend on a CI pipeline
  • Experiment and create rapid prototypes


What to expect

  • Your opinion to matter
  • To work in an agile, cross functional, devops enabled team
  • To work with a product designer, a product manager and an engineer in test
  • To work on functional and non functional testing
  • To build lots of stuff from scratch and rewrite quite as many
  • To work on performance and SEO
  • To move beyond frameworks and take advantage of modern browser tech
  • To enjoy some quality engineering
  • To get your hands on latest goodies - we’re open-minded geeks
  • A rapidly growing company
  • Cool colleagues :)


Interview process

  • Video call dialogue with People Team
  • Coding assignment (3+ working days)
  • Technical Interview, 2+ hours long
  • Interview with Head of engineering

What to expect at the technical interview?

You will be called to have a long discussion with your future team members. This discussion will cover many things from CS fundamentals to latest web and Javascript tech. So we encourage you to do a quick refresh on topics like data structures, algos and runtime complexity as well as core Javascript and web fundamentals. We will also try to tackle some real-world software design problems together as we do every other day. It may sound scary but it's really not. We want you to succeed.
requirements:
• 2+ years of full-time industry experience working with web technologies
  • Strong web fundamentals and solid understanding of the 2020's web ecosystem
  • Strong Javascript skills (ES2015+)
  • Strong HTML & CSS skills
  • An eye for good UX
  • Core Web APIs like DOM, Storage, Fetch etc should not be strange to you
  • Really comfortable with Git
  • Excellent communication in English
  • BS/MS degree in Computer Science or a related subject
  • Bonus: experience doing fullstack development on Node.js
  • Bonus: knowing your way around *nix shell
  • Bonus: experience in software testing

title: Business Analyst
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning. But enough of the numbers.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a Business Analyst to join our high performing team based in Athens. Business Analysts at Blueground focus on identifying opportunities, conducting rigorous analyses, defining metrics, and generating insights to provide actionable recommendations. As a Business Analyst you will work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and city General Managers across multiple markets. This is a great opportunity to develop your career in a fast growing global organisation.

What you will focus on:

  • Define market level strategy and support pricing operations
  • Develop dashboards and reports to assess the performance and impact of pricing decisions
  • Communicate data analyses and recommendations to leadership and relevant stakeholders
  • Collaborate with the Business Intelligence team to develop demand and pricing forecasting models
  • Research market trends and competitor data to identify revenue optimization opportunities

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university
  • Strong analytical and communication skills
  • Advanced excel skills
  • Fluency in English
  • Working knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and/or Google Sheets will be considered a plus

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Financial Analyst
description:

By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Financial Analyst to join our high performing Finance team based in Athens and act as a Finance contact for all the Blueground cities. You will focus on providing valid financial management information to the Financial Analysis Manager in order to facilitate decision support, resulting in growth of revenues and profitability.

What you will focus on:

  • Develop bulletproof, excel-based tools that ensure accurate reporting and facilitate automations
  • Build insightful financial models that will either shed light to the company's current business performance or help forecast/project future trends.
  • Push excellence via process improvement proposals across the F&A function
  • Partner with the function leaders and provide interpretation, undertake proactive analytical and other investigations, analyze past results, identify trends, and make recommendations for improvements
  • Develop analyses, strategic materials, and presentations for senior leadership
  • Support the senior management and the company’s strategic objectives with ad hoc financial analysis and reporting projects
  • Improve the way we work, grow and report

What we are looking for:

  • Bachelor’s degree from a top-tier university with a quantitative focus. Could be Economics / Finance or Engineering / Mathematics / Statistics / Computer Science.
  • At least 1 year of experience in analytical roles in Finance, Strategy or Business Operations; high-growth / early-stage start-up experience considered a plus
  • Outstanding Excel and writing skills required (SQLand/or Google Sheets will be considered a plus)
  • Solid analytical, organizational, planning and problem-solving skills
  • Good communicator with strong interpersonal skills
  • Able to work effectively under pressure and in a rapidly changing environment in order to meet deadlines
  • Be highly self-driven and accountable for deliverables. Have an entrepreneurial, “can-do” attitude
  • Be data-driven and detail-oriented, with an eye for the larger picture and long-term implications

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people

  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

description:

As an E-commerce/ Channel Associate, you will be primarily responsible for assisting the Channel Management team in the listing/advertising process of Blueground properties on classifieds and booking platforms, in order to maximize utilization and occupancy across cities.

What you will focus on:

  • Upload the Blueground properties in the relevant listing sites/channels using the data from our internal database
  • Maintain the content of the properties’ listings/advertisements in order to make sure that all the data are always up to date
  • Join team projects which include research of new channels/listing sites, monitoring the listing sites’ performance, improvement of internal processes, etc.

title: Senior Manager - Public Relations & Communications
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities and we have raised more than $80m in funding to date.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Senior Manager - Public Relations & Communications based in NYC (or working remotely within the US) to join our global marketing team.

You will lead our Global PR and broader communications to promote awareness of our brand, communicate our brand values, and company narrative in alignment with our business goals. You will be reporting to the CMO and be an important partner to the Blueground teams across our corporate services and our operating countries, i.e. USA, UK, France, UAE, Turkey and Greece.

We are looking for a communicator with strong storytelling abilities, excellent writing skills, substantive experience engaging business, consumer and technology media, and a proven track record for pitching and placing stories.

This position is responsible for all communications (external and internal) including selecting and managing PR agencies across the operating countries. In addition, this role supports an integrated marketing approach, ensuring consistent messaging is delivered to the target audience across a variety of marketing channels.

What you will focus on:

  • Strategize communication plans and develop and execute integrated PR campaigns that tell the Blueground company story in a compelling way and help drive Blueground’s reputation as an innovator and industry leader
  • Cultivate strategic relationships with relevant media outlets & journalists, while identifying, onboarding, and managing day-to-day PR agency relationships in select markets-
  • Hire, coach and inspire a lean team or remotely-based communications professionals to deliver various projects with external and internal audiences
  • Set, influence and monitor KPIs to clearly demonstrate the impact of PR in the business
  • Research, identify and pitch stories and bylines to key reporters and relevant media outlets nurturing a network of trade, technology and business press contacts
  • Work closely with country business units and develop communication programs in each country in alignment with the global communication strategy
  • Train and mentor company spokespeople to deliver consistent and compelling messages that support our company narrative
  • Follow industry trends and develop company positions to respond to news and inbound media inquiries
  • Create communications for news media, including articles, biographies, press kits, press releases, scripts and other content initiatives as needed
  • Build a ‘thought leadership’ platform by creating content, securing speaking slots, bylined articles and other mediums to increase Blueground’s position as the de facto leader in our space
  • Organize owned events to promote relationship with various business partners
  • Partner with the People team to develop strategic plan for internal communications, providing oversight on both mass and targeted employee communications
  • Lead and coordinate event sponsorships in collaboration with the local teams
  • Create and maintain a favourable brand image of the company across review websites like Google My Business, Glassdoor, Yelp, etc
  • Lead cross functional relationships with brand, product, sales and other key departments within the company to identify critical product differentiation for storytelling, while ensuring key stakeholders (internal & external) are informed & supportive of plans

What we are looking for:

  • 7+ years of brand and corporate public relations experience (3+ years at manager level), either in-house or at a top-tier agency
  • A track record of creating and executing impactful PR campaigns that achieve qualitative and quantitative results
  • Established relationships/contacts with media outlets & journalists in key s lifestyle, tech, interior design & hospitality in the USA (required) and Europe (preferred)
  • Great storytelling, writing (newswriting, speechwriting) and presentation skills
  • Multi-tasker with a hands on mindset, able to manage end to end projects from conception to execution
  • Great understanding of how PR works together with brand, SEO, social media and influencer marketing strategies
  • Creative, yet analytical. Able to prioritize, multi-task, and work well under tight and shifting deadlines
  • Collaborative and team-oriented, demonstrating a high degree of confidentiality and professionalism
  • Bachelor's degree in Journalism, Public Relations, Communications or equivalent practical experience

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • Health Insurance (medical, dental and vision plans)
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai

title: General Manager - Vienna
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities and we have raised more than $80m in funding to date.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.


We are currently recruiting a General Manager for our imminent launch in the city of Vienna.

The GM position is one of the most exciting and impactful roles at Blueground. As the leader of Vienna office and a member of Blueground’s global leadership team, you will own your P&L and manage all business activities: from hiring your team, to on-boarding and marketing units, to building strong relationships with the local real estate industry. You will be responsible for launching, scaling and owning the Vienna market. If you like ownership, leadership and hustling, while being very strategic and analytical in your approach, this is the right role for you.

What you will focus on:

  • Owning the P&L for Blueground's Vienna business
  • Building and scaling a best-in-class team for real estate, operations and sales
  • Defining city priorities and goals, and managing performance on a monthly and quarterly basis by setting relevant KPIs and incentive structure
  • Identifying unexplored opportunities and adapting the business model to local requirements, taking into account local regulatory constraints
  • Staying actively educated on Vienna real estate trends to adapt and refine leasing strategy
  • Shaping and sharing best practices with the rest of the network towards the constant efficiency improvement of our global operations.
  • Being the face of Blueground in Vienna - local PR and networking events
  • Collaborating with Product, Revenue Management, Marketing, Technology and Client Experience teams to meet the needs of local market

What we are looking for:

  • Relevant experience (at least 3 years) in leading teams
  • Entrepreneurial drive, adaptability, and focus on results
  • Ability to work independently, effectively and efficiently
  • P&L experience
  • Excellent communication skills in German
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives
  • Analytical and data-driven decision making

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Discretionary annual bonus scheme
  • Stock options plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the center of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

description:

The role will be working closely with Vienna's General Manager and local 3rd party providers (e.g., related to cleaning, maintenance) in preparing new units, ensuring that existing units are perfect for our guests, handling any issues or emergencies that arise (guest lockouts, emergency relocations) as well as continuous improvement of our business systems and processes.

This position will possibly require weekend hours.

What you will mostly focus on:

  • Full operational set-up and maintenance coordination of Blueground properties (furnishing, supplies, services, etc) according to brand style and guidelines
  • Perform check-ins and exit inspections to our properties according to business standards
  • Track and organize keys/parking remotes, take basic photography, and other small projects.
  • Be the main point of contact between our guests and the customer experience team
  • Help build, maintain and coordinate partnerships with 3rd party providers (eg cleaning, maintenance) along with the GM
  • Liaise, manage and negotiate with contractors, vendors and external business partners ensuring that our guests enjoy high standards of client experience
  • Drive down operational costs and constantly improve processes, while upholding Blueground’s quality standards
  • Assist the General Manager in local projects on the computer in spreadsheet, word processing, and email programs
  • Coordinate with Blueground’s central team to incorporate best practices and integrate tools and methodology

  • Manage viewings at Blueground properties for prospective clients or partners

  • Fluent in both German and English
  • Willingness to get hands ‘dirty’ as needed to achieve operational excellence
  • Background in maintenance and handy work will be considered as a plus
  • Problem solver, with ability to work in a fast-paced and "get the job done" culture

  • Ability to multitask and drive results efficiently
  • Confident user of technology (email, slack, G suite)
  • A positive, confident, upbeat and friendly personality
  • A hospitality background is a strong plus

  • Flexible paid time off

title: Local Purchase Associate
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are looking for a Local Purchase Associate to join our Supply Chain Operations team, based in Istanbul. This role will be the critical link between the warehousing, purchasing and demand planning departments. You will be responsible for ensuring on-time supplier delivery, warehouse readiness and providing inflow-outflow information to the demand planning department. This is a great opportunity for anyone that is keen to grow their career in a fast paced, high performing team that is managing our global supply chain.

What you will focus on:

  • Tracking supply chain orders of abroad markets on a daily basis ensuring timely deliveries, with a direct communication to local warehouses and to local teams
  • Ensuring the product documentation and labeling are completed according to our standards
  • Analyzing supplier performance patterns and constraints and providing insights for the procurement department
  • Registering all inbound orders in the relevant local warehouse system
  • Collaborating closely with Supply Chain Finance team to take corrective actions at the supplier side
  • Assisting in building monthly supply chain dashboard for the top management
  • Tracking the root causes of operational problems and build infrastructure

What we are looking for:

  • University Degree from Engineering departments or BA
  • Minimum 2 years Supply Chain Experience (preferably in planning, logistics and warehousing departments)
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Exceptional verbal and written communication skills
  • Advanced excel skills
  • Fluency in English is required for this role
  • A good balance of being assertive and collaborative

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

title: Teknik Saha Elemanı
description:
Blueground olarak, kişilerin yaşamayı seçtikleri her yerde kendilerini evlerinde hissetmelerini sağlamak vizyonuyla hareket ediyoruz. Dünyanın en gözde lokasyonlarında, taşınmaya hazır tam donanımlı daireler sunarak müşterilerimize #ShowUpStartLiving

fırsatı sağlıyoruz.Arka planda, harika bir ekibin çalışmaktan mutlu olduğu bir organizasyon ile, misafirlerimizinsevdiği teknoloji destekli bir yaşam deneyimi için çalışıyoruz.Kurulduğumuz 2013 yılından bu yana aldığımız yatırımlarla 12 şehirde 3500 eve ulaştık. Bu süreçte aldığımız 78 milyon dolarlık yatırım, yalnızca başlangıç. Bu başarının sırrı, ekip üyelerimizin her birinin temel değerlerimize uygunluğudur.

Ekibimiz için ‘zaman’ her şeydir ve bunun kıymetini biliyoruz.‘Mükemmellik’ sadece bir standart değil, hayata bakmanın heyecan verici bir yoludur.Müşterilerimize ve ekip üyelerimize derinden ‘değer’ veriyoruz ve insan odağını kaybetmeden bunu ‘şeffaflık’ ilkemiz ile bağdaştırarak hayatlarımızı günden güne kolaylaştırıyoruz.

İŞ TANIMI

Firma bünyesinde bulunan gayrımenkullerin bakım ve onarım işlerinin (elektrik, tesisat, iklimlendirme sistemleri vb) gerçekleştirmesi;bina ortak mahal ve merkezi sistem ile alakalı işlerde bina tekniği yada görevli ile iletişimde bulunarak sorunların çözümlenmesi ve takip edilmesi.Müşteri hizmetleri ve kalite kontrol ekibi ile sürekli iletişim halinde olunması, belirli dönemlerde gayrımenkul demirbaş ve durum envanterlerin kontrolü ve güncellenmesi, yedek ve sarf malzeme ile ilgili ihtiyaçların düzenli olarak depo sorumlusuna bildirilmesi ve takip edilmesi, portföyümüze katılan yeni dairelerin teknik kontrollerinin yapılması görevlerini yürütecektir.

Aranan Nitelikler

-Meslek Lisesi veya Meslek Yüksek Okulu mezunu; Elektik/Elektronik,Mekatronik ve benzeri bölümlerden mezun, mesleki yeterlilik belgelerine sahip
-İleri düzeyde elektrik-elektronik bilgisi olan, bina bakım, onarım ve tesisat işlerinde tecrübeli
-Minimum 5 yıl hizmet sektöründe deneyimi olan
-A2 ve B sınıfı ehliyeti olan, aktif olarak motor ve araç kullanabilen
-Haftada 6 gün sahada olabilecek, dinamik çalışma ortamlarına ve esnek çalışma saatlerine uyum sağlayabilecek
-Levent merkez olmak üzere, İstanbul’un iki yakasında da günlük atanan görevleri yerine getirebilecek
-Teknolojiye meraklı, gelişime açık, öğrenmeyi ve araştırmayı alışkanlık haline getirmiş, bilgisayar kullanabilen, dikkatli, titiz çalışan, teknik el becerisine güvenen
-Müşteri memnuniyetini temel ilke olarak benimsemiş
-Dış görünümüne ve kişisel bakımına özen gösteren
-Tercihen başlangıç ve orta seviye İngilizce bilgisi olan

title: Software Product Manager
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning. But enough of the numbers.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day easier.

We are looking for a talented Software Product Manager to join our growing Software Product Management team based in Athens and work on our product.

We are a tech-enabled company currently making substantial investments in our technology products to enable our next stage of high growth. As a Product Manager, you will be responsible for the vision, strategy and execution of all initiatives that will ensure our guests get value out of Blueground. You will be accountable for understanding guest needs, providing that our product offering exceeds their expectations and drive towards an organization-wide metric for guest satisfaction and retention. It is a highly cross-functional role and is critical for the success of Blueground.

We are looking for someone to develop a deep understanding of our guests, set the vision for guest satisfaction, and define the strategy and roadmap to achieve that vision. You will be expected to holistically approach business-wide challenges and lead your teams to creatively and effectively solve the highest priority problems.

What you’ll do

  • Lead the ideation, research, design, development and launch of user-centric products
  • Understand user needs and gather product requirements
  • Identify market opportunities and establish a shared product vision and strategy for your product area
  • Build alignment across product teams, Marketing, Operations, Customer Experience, etc. and Leadership/Executive team
  • Develop the product roadmap and build consensus on prioritization which drives product execution
  • Define and analyze metrics that inform product success & health
  • Drive product development with a world-class team of Engineers and Designers

What to expect

  • To work in agile, cross-functional, DevOps enabled teams
  • A simplified squad mode
  • A team that constantly raises its standards of work
  • A rapidly growing company with top talented people
  • Trust and autonomy
  • To experiment, learn and have fun
  • Cool colleagues :)

Requirements

  • 2+ years of product management experience
  • Demonstrated track record of product leadership.
  • Ability to lead and influence teams
  • Ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience
  • Entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment
  • Radical thinking paired with strong execution.
  • A positive attitude and team player

Your Benefits

  • Workstation of your choice
  • Competitive salary
  • Group Health Insurance program
  • Mobile Data Plan
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in LA and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the centre of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, colour, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.

title: Real Estate Partnerships/Business Development Associate
description:
At Blueground, we are guided by a vision to make people feel at home wherever they choose to live. By offering fully-furnished apartments that are move-in ready in the world’s most vibrant neighborhoods, we provide our guests with the opportunity to simply #ShowUpStartLiving. Behind the scenes, we strive for a tech-powered living experience that guests love, homed in an organization where great people are proud to work.

We’ve grown a lot since our founding in 2013. We are now hosting guests in more than 3,500 homes in 12 cities. We have raised more than $80m in funding to date and that’s just the beginning.

What drives our success is how each of our team members applies our core values. To our team, Time is everything, and we cherish it greatly. For us, Excellence isn’t simply a standard, but an exciting way to look at life. We Care deeply about our clients and colleagues and never lose sight of the human element, which goes hand-in-hand with Transparency which we believe makes our day-to-day life easier.

We are seeking a Real Estate Partnerships/Business Development Associate based in our Washington, DC office, to help us grow our apartment portfolio in the DC area. You will focus on building our apartment supply in selected DC neighborhoods to further fuel our growth and market presence.

If you are a recent graduate or professional, that is looking for a fast-growing career within an international startup company, who possesses an interest in real estate and has strong communication, sales or business development skills, then this role may be for you!

What you will focus on:

  • Developing the business by building and nurturing relationships with leasing managers, real estate agents/brokers, landlords/owners and developers.
  • Achieve agreed upon apartment lease targets and outcomes within schedule
  • Coordinate new apartment on-boarding effort with team members and other departments
  • Analyze neighborhood and building potential, and track apartment performance and lease renewals
  • Prospect, qualify, research, present and close apartment opportunities with institutional and private partners
  • Negotiate and structure favorable apartment lease terms
  • Grow apartment supply pipeline through a combination of cold calling, email campaigns, networking, and local market sector knowledge

What we are looking for:

  • Degree from a top-tier university
  • Min. 2 years of experience in a business development or sales role (residential RE or hospitality experience will be considered as a plus)
  • Real Estate license will be considered a plus
  • Negotiation experience
  • Proficiency with G-suite
  • Strong communication skills and with an eye-to-detail approach
  • Quick thinker and deal maker

Your benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Flexible paid time off
  • Enhanced parental leave
  • 401k retirement plan
  • Private life and health insurance plan
  • Dynamic working environment with talented people
  • Complimentary accommodation in Blueground locations. Think summer in Greece and winter in Dubai!

At Blueground we are proud to have Diversity and Inclusion at the center of everything we do. We are committed to Equal Employment Opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or religion.
